history.proof: intros y. unfold addZ. destruct y. - reflexivity. - reflexivity. - reflexivity.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall y : Z, addZ OZ y = y

Premises:
addZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => x2 | pos n => addpos x2 n | neg n => addneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
BinPos.Pos.min_r : forall x y : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.le y x -> BinPos.Pos.min x y = y
BinNat.N.compare_eq : forall x y : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.compare x y = Eq -> x = y
BinPos.Peqb_true_eq : forall x y : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.eqb x y = true -> x = y
BinInt.Z2Pos.inj_iff : forall x y : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 x -> BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 y -> BinInt.Z.to_pos x = BinInt.Z.to_pos y < -> x = y
BinInt.Z2Pos.inj : forall x y : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 x -> BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 y -> BinInt.Z.to_pos x = BinInt.Z.to_pos y -> x = y
BinPos.Pos.min_l : forall x y : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.le x y -> BinPos.Pos.min x y = x
Fin.FS_inj : forall x y : Fin.t ?n, Fin.FS x = Fin.FS y -> x = y where ?n : [ |- nat]
Znumtheory.Zmult_one : forall x y : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.ge x BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.mul x y = BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH -> x = BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH
BinNat.N.compare_spec : forall x y : BinNums.N, CompareSpec (x = y) (BinNat.N.lt x y) (BinNat.N.lt y x) (BinNat.N.compare x y)
opp_unicity : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall x y : S, is_opposite S G Add O x y -> y = Opp x
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.gt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.gt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.lt = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.lt (_ _)%positive_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.ge = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.ge (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.le = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.le (_ _)%positive_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinNat.N.le = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.le (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.min_compat = fun (x x' : BinNums.Z) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : BinNums.Z) (Hy : y = y') => let H1 : BinInt.Z.lt x y /\ BinInt.Z.min x y = x \/ BinInt.Z.le y x /\ BinInt.Z.min x y = y := BinInt.Z.min_spec x y in let H2 : BinInt.Z.lt x' y' /\ BinInt.Z.min x' y' = x' \/ BinInt.Z.le y' x' /\ BinInt.Z.min x' y' = y' := BinInt.Z.min_spec x' y' in let m := BinInt.Z.min x y in let m' := BinInt.Z.min x' y' in let o : BinInt.Z.lt x y \/ x = y \/ BinInt.Z.lt y x := BinInt.Z.lt_total x y in match o with | or_introl H => or_ind (fun H0 : BinInt.Z.lt x y /\ m = x => and_ind (fun (H3 : BinInt.Z.lt x y) (H4 : m = x)...
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct x} : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => BinPosDef.Pos.add y (BinNums.xO (mul p y)) | BinNums.xO p => BinNums.xO (mul p y) | BinNums.xH => y end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.mul (_ _)%positive_scope
opp_add : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> commutativity S Add -> forall x y : S, G x -> G y -> Opp (Add x y) = Add (Opp x) (Opp y)
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.compare = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => Eq | BinNums.Zpos _ => Lt | BinNums.Zneg _ => Gt end | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinPos.Pos.compare x' y' | _ => Gt end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Zneg y' => CompOpp (BinPos.Pos.compare x' y') | _ => Lt end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> comparison Arguments BinIntDef.Z.compare (_ _)%Z_scope
Z_ind : forall P : Z -> Prop, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rect : forall P : Z -> Type, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rec : forall P : Z -> Set, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_sind : forall P : Z -> SProp, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
succ_predZ : forall x : Z, succZ (predZ x) = x
pred_succZ : forall x : Z, predZ (succZ x) = x
BinPosDef.Pos.add = fix add (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct x} : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (add_carry p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ p) end | BinNums.xO p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xO (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xI p end | BinNums.xH => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI q | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO BinNums.xH end end with add_carry (x y : BinNums.positive) {...
eq_OZ_dec : forall x : Z, {x = OZ} + {x <> OZ}
succ_pred_pred_succZ : forall x : Z, succZ (predZ x) = predZ (succZ x)
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
absZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
sgnZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos _ => pos 0 | neg _ => neg 0 end : Z -> Z
succZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => IZ | pos n => pos (S n) | neg 0 => OZ | neg (S m) => neg m end : Z -> Z
predZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => neg 0 | pos 0 => OZ | pos (S m) => pos m | neg n => neg (S n) end : Z -> Z
posOZ = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => OZ | S n' => pos n' end : nat -> Z Arguments posOZ _%nat_scope
negOZ = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => OZ | S n' => neg n' end : nat -> Z Arguments negOZ _%nat_scope
ZMicromega.isZ0_0 : forall x : BinNums.Z, ZMicromega.isZ0 x = true < -> x = BinNums.Z0
